record.field: 1. Which of the following is NOT an item listed in the buy-grid framework?
a. Search for and qualification of potential sources
b. Evaluation of proposals and selection of suppliers
c. Anticipation of order and listing of quantity needed
2. The business buyer convert all the benefits and cost into
3. The consumption, spoilage, or wear and tear on the stock of goods within the individual’s assortment is a definition of ______
4. Taking up a new hobby such as learning to windsurf is a result of ______
c. a shift in the actual state
5. The business buyers seek the benefits in economic, social and technical terms and in total classified as
6. The difference between perceived costs and perceived benefits is classified as
7. Movement types play a central role in good movements in SAP ERP. Which of the following statements are true regarding movement types?
a. The movement type blanked whether a goods movement is a goods issue or a goods receipt
b. Each movement type has it’s respective cancellation movement type, which corresponds to the number of the movement type A
c. In inventory management the movement type of a goods movement controls which stock account in Management Accounting is used for value based stock changes
d. The screen layout of the input mask for document entry or for updating quantity fields is controlled by the movement type used
8. What is determined through conditions in a purchase order?

9. A purchase order is a formal demand for a vendor for supplying particular goods or services under the negotiated conditions stated in the purchase order. Which of the following statements are false regarding purchase orders?
a. Purchase orders contain a header level, an item detail, an item summarization
b. A purchase order can be created without reference to a purchase requisition
c. A purchase order derivers information from vendor master data, material master data, and purchasing info records
d. A purchase order can initiate a stock transport order in another plant of the company
10. Which ones are not included in the purchase order types
11. Purchase Budget has an impact on ___
b. Materials Budget of the company
12. Purchase operation does not contain this classification of work?
13. ___ is a register of suppliers invited to submit bids for goods or services as specified
14. Which contract type should be used by the owner on a high risk project?
a. Cost plus percentage of cost
d. Fixed price plus incentive fee
15. A bilateral RFP is preferred to an invitation to bid when ___
a. Supplier and terms are specified
b. The product or service is relatively low value and readily available
c. The product or service has high value and is unique
d. The product of service has high value, but is easy to obtain
16. The different between the net hire purchase price and net cash price of the goods is termed as
17. When an asset is acquired on hire purchase system, the asset account is debited with ___ of the assets in the books of the hire purchaser
18. On the balance sheet of a company, the value of the asset bought through hire purchase will appear as:
a. Cost less depreciation to date less Balance in hire vendor’s
b. Cost less amounts owing on hire purchase
c. Cost less depreciation to date less amount owing on hire purchase
d. Cost less depreciation to date
19. If there is any default in payment, the seller has the right to repossess the goods and forfeit the amount already received
20. The value at which goods are reposed is transferred to ___ in the books of the vendor
21. Cost of materials in addition to the cost of labor output to create a product is known as the cost of good sold

22. Bid bond is a form of bid security purchased by a bidder; manufacturer, subject to forfeit, to guarantee that the bidder will enter into a contract with the staff for construction of the facility within a short time period
23. Which of the following is not a type of supplier sourcing?
24. What is the reason for the forced situation of sticking to only one supplier for the organization in sole sourcing?
c. Only one organization producing the item
d. Two organization producing the item
25. The following traffic assignment model tries to estimate an equilibrium solution based on the all or none assignment model
26. When suppliers, distributors, and customers partner with each other to improve the performance of the entire system, they are participating in a _____
a. When there is an organized commodity market
b. Where large quantities of a particular commodity are bought and sold
28. A supply chain is a sequence of firms that perform activities required:
a. to find products that are similar
b. to facilitate wholesalers inventory selections
c. to create synergy in their training programs
d. to create and deliver goods to consumers
29. If a customer return the product if it is not matching with ordered one then picking up of the product is part of _____
30. The factors such as ___, costs, and also the situations of technology change must be considered while selecting a location.
1. As a content writer what do you mean by social media content writing?
a. Social media content writing is all about writing captions
b. Social media content writing is about writing anything in social media
c. Social media content writing is the only way to connect with audience
d. Social media content writing is to target the right audience, the overall message should be written in your own voice and it should be easy and make proper communication with the audience
2. What are the on-page SEO strategies that content writers should know?
3. Complete the following sentences with the correct pair of words. I wanted to give her a ____ of my mind but stopped myself from doing so. II. ____ of mind is not a luxury
a. It is the visible text that is hyperlinked to another page
b. It is the main body of text on a particular web page
c. It is the most prominent text on the page that the search engines use to assign a title to the page
d. It is the text within the left or top panel of a webpage
5. What happens if you type the words Certification -Networking in the Google search box?
a. Google shows web pages that contain the word Certification
b. Google shows all the web pages in which the words Certification and Networking appear together
c. Google shows all the web pages containing the words Certification and Networking
d. Google shows web pages that contain the word Certification and also those that contain the word Networking
6. Which of the following is among the search engine optimization 'best practices'?
a. no one other than the copyright holder can use the work without the holder's authorization under any circumstances
b. Show either of the two years
c. the copyright holder is free to exercise the bundle of rights that come with the ownership of the copyright
8. What things should you bear in mind when writing something?
d. The message you want to convey
9. Which of the following is an important component of formatting?
c. It will show web pages containing the words content writer in the URL
10. Do you need Wikipedia's permission to reuse textual content contained on that website?
a. Wikipedia is silent on this issue
b. Yes. Failing to obtain such permission will amount to copyright infringement
11. At what point in time does the copyright for original website content originate?
a. Reproducing copyrighted material for fair use
b. When the work goes online
c. When the work is registered with the copyright and trademark office
d. When the author displays the copyright sign below the content or website
12. Which of the following acts constitutes copyright infringement?
a. Reproducing copyrighted material for 'fair use'
c. Reproducing a work which is in the public domain
d. Reproducing copyrighted material on a free website
13. Do you have to use a copyright notation on all copies of your content for the web?
a. It is best to concentrate the keywords in the middle of the web page
b. No. A copyright notation is no longer an absolute necessity of the Copyright Act
c. Yes. The copyright notation is necessary to protect the content
d. No. As long as the website has a general copyright notation
14. A short introductory statement in a published work such as a book is called:
15. Which of the following is true in the context of Search Engine Optimization?
a. The title of a web page should be at least 10 words long
b. It is best to concentrate the keywords in the middle of the web page
c. It is preferable to optimize one web page for only one keyword
d. A keyword density of 15-20 % is regarded as optimum
16. Copying a few lines from one of Shakespeare's works without giving credit to him would be considered:
17. Which of the following statements regarding Search Engine Optimization is true?
a. Keywords should never be used in the URL
c. Including keywords in the anchor text is a good SEO strategy
18. What are some of the ways to make an article effective?
c. Write long articles. The longer an article
19. Why is it important to make regular postings if not daily postings to your blog?
a. To encourage a regular readership, returning traffic, and so web robots can see your blog is regularly active
b. It isn't making daily postings can be harmful to your blog
c. Otherwise it will be unplugged by the blog service provider
20. Fooling the search engines with link farms, keyword stuffing, cloaking or alt text spamming is not a good idea because _____
a. it is an offense in most countries
b. the search engines may restrict your site or future listings, or ban you altogether
c. it could reduce the traffic to your blog
21. What can you do to make your articles more appealing to online readers?
a. Create external links and quality posts
b. Add a message board and or chat room to encourage interactivity
c. Increase the product or site image or professional branding
22. What is a plagiarism warning banner?
a. A banner e-mailed to you by a potential plagiarist to warn you of their potential copying of your site
b. A banner you place on your site or blog to deter potential plagiarists
c. A government service that bans plagiarists from the Web with an official warning, usually a letter to their home address
23. If you write something libelous in a blog, you can still be used for written defamation despite the apparent freedom of expression on the internet
24. What is the term used for the number of times the keyword is used, decided by the total word count on the page?
25. There is little need to copy text before trying to publish it to the web because you rarely lose the text at the time publication
26. Which of the following is most likely to guarantee the content on your blog is professional, subject appropriate and grammatically correct?
a. Copying it into Word, spell checking, and copying it back
b. Asking a friend to read it
c. Reading it through before posting
d. Having several specialist readers check out the content for its relevance, sense, argument, and keywords
27. What kind of writing style will you use for describing a university application process meant to be read by the student applicants and or their parents?
a. Use italics for the parents and bold text for the students or vice versa
b. Use your normal writing style
c. Use a style suited for the students, as they are more important
d. Use a style that will be read by both the students and the parents equally successfully
28. Do you have to use a copyright notation on all copies of your content for the web?
a. No. A copyright notation is no longer an absolute necessity of the Copyright Act
b. Yes. The copyright notation is necessary to protect the content
c. No. As long as the website has a general copyright notation, it is not required to be placed below all content
29. At what point in time does the copyright for original website content originate?
a. No. As long as the website has a general copyright notation, it is not required to be placed below all content
b. At the time the work is created
c. When the work is registered with the copyright and trademark office
d. When the work goes online
b. A language element, such as a word, often used in blogs to identify the type or types of content that makes up a particular post
c. A long post that goes onto another page
